info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 9:49AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...AN AREA OF MODERATE TO BRIEFLY HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...NORTHEASTERN GREENE AND NORTHERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 948 AM EST, an area of moderate to briefly heavy snow showers was located along a line extending from New Stanton to near Monongahela. Movement was south at 15 mph. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Connellsville, Gastonville, South Park Township, Jefferson Hills, Monessen, California, Donora, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Monongahela, Charleroi, Youngwood, West Newton, Bentleyville, Brownsville, New Stanton, Fredericktown-Millsboro, South Connellsville, and Perryopolis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 72 and 82. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
